title: How to Temporarily Colour Your Hair Purple at Minimal Cost

steps.headline: Buy a bottle of Gentian Violet from your local drugstore.
steps.description: It is used to treat cuts and wounds and should be relatively cheap. Don't buy a bottle that is too big as you'll only be using a little bit (even if your hair is long).

steps.headline: Prepare by washing your hair thoroughly.
steps.description: Put a towel down where you'll be working. If you're working in a bathroom, be careful! Gentian Violet will stain porcelain and furniture.

steps.headline: Place a few drops (4-8) of Gentian Violet in a small, disposable container and dilute it.
steps.description: To dilute, it is a good idea to use any water-based hair product such as heat protection, although water is fine.

steps.headline: Put gloves on your hands to prevent staining of skin
Using a small, soft, flat brush such as a paintbrush or make-up brush, apply the gentian violet to small areas of hair at a time.
steps.description: If you run out, use more drops. Make sure to dilute it, though or it may turn out black.

steps.headline: Leave it on your hair to set for approximately 5 minutes
Rinse your hair under cool water.
steps.description: If rinsing in a porcelain bathtub, keep some rubbing alcohol handy to remove any purple stains.

steps.headline: Dry and style hair as desired

Put gloves on your hands to prevent staining of skin  Using a small, soft, flat brush such as a paintbrush or make-up brush, apply the gentian violet to small areas of hair at a time. If you run out, use more drops. Make sure to dilute it, though or it may turn out black. Leave it on your hair to set for approximately 5 minutes  Rinse your hair under cool water. If rinsing in a porcelain bathtub, keep some rubbing alcohol handy to remove any purple stains. Dry and style hair as desired
